review: The Chromecast is an interesting idea: Stream content to your TV, from the internet, by means of your other devices. This is a pretty good concept except for one issue: it would be ideal if it didn't ALWAYS require another device, IE if it had or you could buy an affordable remote of its own.In terms of execution: The content designed specifically for Chromecast works well: Netflix, Youtube, Pandora, Google Music. I've notice that triggering the Chromecast via my phone works better than from within Chrome on my laptop. However there have been some glitches from each. I like how I can start something on my laptop and then later control it from the phone. A great feature is the ability to stream ANY tab from Chrome. This is a great idea but in practice it is laggy and a worse quality than any of the official content "apps." Finally, the cross compatibility (Android, iOS devices, any computer with chrome) for setup and use is great.Overall the Chromecast is a good idea and provided at an excellent price, I just wish it had more content. The SDK, the thing content developers use to allow chrome casting, is still in limited distribution and I think this is why we haven't seen more apps. If every, or most apps had chromecasting this would be perhaps, THE tv streaming solution due to its price. Until then its another fun Google toy thats 80% complete.

review: For $35 you can't beat this streaming player. The HDMI (1080p) is incredible on Netflix. I could never get this hi-rez on my tablet, probably because it is too slow to handle 1080 data rate. With Chromecast, no stuttering, freezing, or bad syncing of the sound.  It's also nice that you don't have to have a physical connection between the tablet or phone and the HDTV. So far I have only used it for NetFlix, and u-tube. Haven't tried Chrome browser. While it is true that the steaming apps are limited, for $35, I can't complain.Setup was trivially simple with no issues at all. MY HDTV does have a USB port for providing 5V power to the Chromecast so the physical setup was a snap. If you HDTV doesn't have a USB port, a line connected USB port is provided.
